description: Gr Auto Gallery is pleased to offer this 1973 Volvo P1800ES 2 door station wagon for consideration. The P1800, on the market for 10 years now as a 2 door coupe, gained massive popularity as a sporty and extremely reliable car that was visually pleasing. In 1972 Volvo introduced the ES version as a wagon so to gain traction in the utility and wagon market. The car carried the same most excellent look as the P1800 couple, same rock solid mechanicals and same sporty feel, but gave the car more passenger and cargo room. The P1800 is known for its longevity with an example still on the road surpassing 3 million miles in September 2013.

The 1973 Volvo P1800 ES offered here is a highly original example showing just 102428 miles on the odometer. The car has received one repaint in its original Ocean Blue Metallic. The car is powered by its B20F fuel injected engine, 4 speed manual transmission with overdrive and rear wheel drive. The car features a very tidy interior, featuring an excellent dash, seats and carpeting. Other highlights original working gauges, original trim and bumpers, original glass, upgraded wheels, Kenwood sound system, and excellent mechanicals.  The car comes to us from California and has had 3 owners prior to our recent acquisition and is a proven driver.

The Volvo P1800 ES has recently fallen in favor of car enthusiasts around the globe. Known as the Adventurer, their reliability, design and utility make them easy cars to own, drive and enjoy. The ES was only available for two years and for this reason, the cars remain quite rare and quality examples are few and far between. It is no secret that the vintage European car market is on fire and the Volvo P1800 ES wagons are rapidly increasing in value with values surpassing 40,000 dollars plus. A tidy example as the car offered here is sure to bring enjoyment and investment at the price offered here.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com
title: 1973 Volvo P1800 ES

description: Look what came from California to Michigan. This 1974 VOLVO 164e has only 18740 ACTUAL MILES.   Absolutely no rust and in gorgeous condition, this Volvo has been driven on several long trips and it is ready to go anywhere. The fuel injected engine runs strong, uses no oil, runs cool and has no issues.  The 3 speed automatic is smooth and it works exactly as it should. We received this Volvo after it had been in long storage, so we resolved any issues and drove it all over to make sure we had awoken this beauty from it's long sleep. Original paint, original interior, new tires, new brake hoses, rebuilt brake hydraulics, and an effective AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM add the intrigue of this exceptional 43 year old Volvo. The sun roof does not open, but everything else, right down to the clock functions like it should.
title: 1974 Volvo 164e

description: STK 2010    1959 Volvo PV445 Pickup   specialkarosser AB Skab     Back in the late '50s there were a few companies in Sweden that built these rare PV445 Pickup trucks in conjunction with Volvo. AB Skab built this one in 1959 and then it was completely restored in 2007. The PV445 has the same frame as the Volvo station wagon with a custom cab and various bed configurations. This truck has a wooden flat bed that has been beautifully re-constructed from white ash. The bare frame was blasted and repainted with epoxy primer/paint. The cab was professionally rebuilt by hand and then painted in the original Volvo Gun Metal Grey. This truck is powered by an 1800cc B18 Volvo engine with a 4-speed M40 manual transmission. The front suspension has been rebuilt and new u-joints, shocks, balanced driveshaft and rear suspension components have been added. The interior was fully restored and the original-look red and white vinyl seats, dashboard, headliner and door panels are all in good condition. Some of the original paperwork and manuals are also included. This PV445 is ready for a new Volvo owner who can enjoy something very rare and quite unique. Please call 800.650.1055, or visit www.autobarnclassiccars.com for additional information. ALL VEHICLES SOLD AS IS.
title: 1959 Volvo Pickup 445

description: *** THIS CAR IS PHYSICALLY LOCATED ON STATEN ISLAND,NY ***    This is a 1967 Volvo P1800s with 18,960 miles on the odometer (118,960 actual).  The car has had a full rotisserie restoration and is painted in Burgundy which is complemented by a new Black interior.    This 1967 Volvo P1800s has lots of new components including: New Brakes all around; New Brake Lines; New Gas Tank; New Rims, New Tires, Carburetors (air cleaners included!) and a New Clutch. On the interior, New Carpet, New Headliner and reupholstered Seats.    Check out the underside of the car; she is clean, undercoated and looks like new.  We have the original wheels and hubcaps for the car which are painted the color of the body and which have very good tires mounted on them. The car came with factory AC which is not currently operational but the in car components and the compressor are installed.    All in all, this car is solid, check the floors, the rocker panels and the trunk floor; it's ready to drive and ready for the summer.  Great for cruising the coast or for a jaunt through the mountains and back roads, this car is fun to drive and attracts attention wherever you go.  Do not let the opportunity to own this car pass you by.  We have priced this vehicle to provide you the best deal on a car of this caliber. description: 1961 Volvo PV 544 - Utah Showroom  The Volvo PV is a series of two-door, four-passenger car models â€” the PV444 and the PV544 â€” made by Volvo from 1947 to 1966. During World War II's early stages, Volvo decided that a new, smaller car that could deliver good fuel economy would assure the company's future.  In 1958, the PV544 was phased in. Subtle differences with the PV444 included the introduction of a curved one-piece windshield to replace the two panes of flat glass, larger taillights, and a ribbon-type speedometer. The 444's 3-speed manual transmission was also supplanted by a 4-speed unit in the 544.  The next significant change occurred in 1962, when the B16 was replaced by Volvo's new B18 engine, initially developed for the P1800 sports car introduced the previous year. This 1.8 L engine had five main bearings. Again single and twin carburettor versions were offered, designated B18A and B18D, respectively. The U.S. market saw very few[vague] B18A cars since the United States' public prioritised performance over fuel economy. Also in 1962, Volvo changed from 6- to 12-volt electrical systems. In 1963 Volvo began producing the 544 at their new Canadian Dartmouth/Halifax plant, the first Volvo plant to be located outside of Sweden.   This PV 544 is equipped with the 1.8 litre inline 4 cylinder that was developes for the P1800 sports car. It also has the 4 speed manual transmission. This is one of the finest examples anywhere.
title: 1961 Volvo PV 544
